question: Which of the following statements about the Application Layer (Layer 7) are correct? (Select all that apply)
correct: It provides user interfaces and services directly to end-user applications
It manages application-level protocols like HTTP, FTP, and SMTP
It enables application-to-application communication
incorrect: It handles packet routing between networks
It handles data formatting and presentation
hint: Think about the layer that interfaces directly with user applications and provides network services to them.

question: Which statements about application ports are true? (Select all that apply)
correct: Ports are 16-bit numbers that identify specific applications or services
Multiple applications can share the same port number, but not simultaneously on the same IP address
The port number range is from 0 to 65535
incorrect: Ports are physical connections on network interface cards
All application ports must be registered with IANA
hint: Consider how operating systems use ports to manage multiple network connections.

question: Regarding port number ranges, which of the following are correct? (Select all that apply)
correct: Well-known ports range from 0 to 1023
Registered ports range from 1024 to 49151
Dynamic/private ports range from 49152 to 65535
hint: Remember the three main categories of port numbers and their standard ranges.

question: Which characteristics apply to TCP (Transmission Control Protocol)? (Select all that apply)
correct: It provides connection-oriented communication
It guarantees delivery of packets
It includes sequence numbers for packet ordering
hint: Think about TCP's primary focus on reliable data delivery.

question: Which statements about UDP (User Datagram Protocol) are correct? (Select all that apply)
correct: It is connectionless
It provides faster transmission than TCP
hint: Consider UDP's focus on speed versus reliability.

question: Which statements about HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) are accurate? (Select all that apply)
correct: It operates on port 80 by default
It uses GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE methods
It is stateless by nature
It can transfer various types of data including text, images, and videos
hint: Think about the basic characteristics and operations of HTTP.

question: Which statements about HTTPS (HTTP Secure) are true? (Select all that apply)
correct: It operates on port 443 by default
It encrypts data in transit
It uses TLS for security
It provides authentication of the web server
It protects against man-in-the-middle attacks
hint: Consider the security features that HTTPS adds to HTTP.

question: Regarding HTTP request structure, which statements are correct? (Select all that apply)
correct: It consists of a request line, headers, and body
The request line includes the HTTP method, URL, and protocol version
incorrect: Headers are optional in all HTTP requests
The body is required in all HTTP requests
hint: Think about the basic components that make up an HTTP request.

question: Which statement about TLS (Transport Layer Security) is correct? (Select all that apply)
correct: It provides end-to-end encryption for data in transit
incorrect: It only works with HTTP protocol
It operates at the application layer
It cannot be used with email protocols
hint: Consider the primary purpose and functionality of TLS.

question: Which statements about SMTP and SMTPS are correct? (Select all that apply)
correct: SMTP operates on port 25 by default
SMTPS adds TLS encryption to SMTP
incorrect: They are used primarily for receiving email
hint: Think about the basic mail transfer protocol and its secure version.

question: Which statements about POP3 (Post Office Protocol 3) are accurate? (Select all that apply)
correct: It operates on port 110 for non-secure connections
It downloads messages to the client and typically removes them from the server
It supports basic email management functions
incorrect: It keeps messages synchronized across multiple devices
hint: Consider how POP3 handles email retrieval and storage.

question: Which characteristics apply to IMAP (Internet Message Access Protocol)? (Select all that apply)
correct: It keeps messages stored on the server
It supports folder management
It allows access from multiple devices
It synchronizes message status across devices
incorrect: It automatically removes messages from the server after download
hint: Think about how IMAP manages email storage and accessibility.

question: Which statements about DNS (Domain Name System) are correct? (Select all that apply)
correct: It translates domain names to IP addresses
It uses UDP port 53 for standard queries
It supports various record types like A, MX, and CNAME
It uses a hierarchical naming structure
It employs caching to improve performance
hint: Consider the core functions and characteristics of the Domain Name System.

question: Which statement about FTP (File Transfer Protocol) is correct? (Select all that apply)
correct: It uses separate control and data channels
incorrect: It uses a single port for all operations
It only supports ASCII file transfers
hint: Think about the basic architecture of FTP.

question: Which statements about FTPS and SFTP are correct? (Select all that apply)
correct: FTPS adds TLS encryption to standard FTP
SFTP operates over SSH protocol
incorrect: They use the same encryption method
They operate on the same default ports
hint: Consider the different approaches to securing file transfers.

question: Which statements about TFTP (Trivial File Transfer Protocol) are correct? (Select all that apply)
correct: It operates on UDP port 69
It provides simpler functionality than FTP
It is commonly used for network device boot and configuration files
hint: Consider TFTP's basic design and common use cases.

question: Which characteristics apply to Telnet? (Select all that apply)
correct: It operates on TCP port 23
It provides terminal emulation
It allows remote command-line access
hint: Think about Telnet's basic functionality and security limitations.

question: Which statements about SSH (Secure Shell) are accurate? (Select all that apply)
correct: It operates on TCP port 22
It provides encrypted remote access
It supports secure file transfers through SFTP
It offers public key authentication
hint: Consider SSH's security features and capabilities.

question: Which statements about DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) are correct? (Select all that apply)
correct: It automatically assigns IP addresses to clients
It can provide gateway and DNS server information
It uses UDP ports 67 and 68
It follows a DORA process (Discover, Offer, Request, Acknowledge)
It can be configured to reserve specific IP addresses for certain devices

question: Which statements about SNMP (Simple Network Management Protocol) are true? (Select all that apply)
correct: It monitors and manages network devices
It uses UDP port 161 for standard operations
hint: Consider SNMP's primary purpose in network management.

question: Which statement about RADIUS (Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service) is correct? (Select all that apply)
correct: It provides centralized authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA)
incorrect: It only works with wireless networks
hint: Think about RADIUS's core function in network access control.

question: Which statements about Syslog are correct? (Select all that apply)
correct: It operates on UDP port 514 by default

It uses severity levels to categorize messages
incorrect: It encrypts log messages by default
hint: Consider how Syslog handles system and network device logging.

question: Which statements about LDAP and LDAPS are accurate? (Select all that apply)
correct: LDAP operates on port 389 by default
LDAPS adds TLS encryption to LDAP

question: Which characteristics apply to SMB (Server Message Block)? (Select all that apply)
correct: It provides file and printer sharing
It supports user authentication
It allows for network browsing

It enables resource access control

question: Which statements about common database ports are correct? (Select all that apply)
correct: MySQL typically uses TCP port 3306
Microsoft SQL Server typically uses TCP port 1433
hint: Think about default ports for popular database systems.

question: Which statements about SIP (Session Initiation Protocol) are correct? (Select all that apply)
correct: It uses TCP/UDP port 5060 for non-secure communications

incorrect: It carries the actual voice data
It only works with video calls

question: Which characteristics apply to RDP (Remote Desktop Protocol)? (Select all that apply)
correct: It operates on TCP port 3389 by default

It allows for clipboard sharing

question: Which of the following protocols typically use UDP? (Select all that apply)
correct: DNS (for queries)
DHCP
TFTP

question: Which of the following protocols use TCP? (Select all that apply)
correct: HTTP
SSH
FTP
SMTP

correct: 443 (HTTPS)
22 (SSH)
